title: The Women of Grayson House Trilogy
features: Olivia Grayson is given an escape for her and her son when she inherits the family estate, Grayson House upon the death of her Aunt. After a tragic accident, Olivia learns it alters her Aunt's will. With few options left to her, she and her only friend, Kathy, devise a plan to take in boarders to fill the many bedrooms of the mansion, strangely left exactly as they were the day each former boarder died. They are stunned to find a hidden second story of the house which appears frozen in time. Olivia is mystified by what happens to her in one of the upstairs bedrooms. She fears she has slipped into madness until she finds her Aunt's and Grandmother's journals.Love, lust and secrets remain and continue at Grayson House as they have for generations. Olivia and her boarders travel a sensuous journey as they discover the secret and search for another journal to discover the reason behind the presence known to them as Adam and the obsession shared by the Women of Grayson House.
description: This is the first book in this trilogy.It is written with great detail and draws upon ideas and customs that are antiquated, but very interesting. Dona pulls you into the story and makes you feel like you are part of the family. Depression Era events are discussed in a nostalgic manner. The house exudes mystery and intrigue and also brings strangers together as a family. Thank you, Dona for sharing these women's stories and the mystery of the house with us.

Dona Fritts Minton is an American Writer who began writing at the age of fifteen and returned to her first passion later in life. Now retired from the medical field, she fills her days in front of her computer with many characters longing for their stories to be heard. She is proudly from East Tennessee and is perpetually working on her next novel.
